review_text: The Cottage home offered me the kind of warm and cozy home I was looking for on my retreat. I found the space to be very relaxing and I loved the personal touches throughout the cottage. The kitchen was probably my favorite place in the cottage as it is so bright and inviting and well stocked with coffee, creamer, sugar, and spices, although some water bottles or small cereal bars or snacks would have been appreciated for extended stays. I wasn’t a huge fan of the jazz decor, but I was glad the space was decorated and not just plain or empty feeling. The bed, pillows and linens were very comfortable. The shower was hot, there’s a tub, but it’s shower only, so I couldn’t soak and relax in the tub as I hoped to. I couldn’t figure how to cut the living room tv on regular or how to cut on the ceiling fans as there are multiple remotes and buttons to figure out. The wifi works pretty good, it just doesn’t work in the backyard, but it’s better on the front porch. I enjoyed my cup of coffee on the front porch each morning. I had an extended stay and had more peace of mind with the alarm. I did great setting it and arming and disarming it, all but once, and it went off loudly, until I could figure how to reset it. The neighbor was friendly, but some neighbors played loud music and worked on cars, houses and yard work which was noisy. The neighborhood is okay, but assuming Garden District, I presumed it would be somewhat better. The street had a mix of people, some friendly, some loud and off putting and a couple streets over is dilapidated houses and not the best areas as I seen when venturing out to the store. The house was overall clean, but the fridge, floors, microwave and tub could’ve been cleaner. It was comfortable and clean, just not quite sparkly. At checkout there is a list to follow, so linens stripped, dishes washed, garbage taken out, thermostat and alarm to set. I checked out a day early and headed home on the last evening after a four day stay. I miss already the coziness and peacefulness of the cottage, it felt like my home away from home. I would stay here again on my next stays in the area, because the cottage is warm and cozy and the hostess is really sweet and friendly.

The apartment is a duplex, behind an apartment complex. The area is quiet. It is nicely decorated with a beachy feel. There are several restaurants near by. When we arrived the bathroom was not clean, tub had hairs in it, wash clothes had long hairs in them, the hand towels were stained, there was food particles in the kitchen sink and the dishes had not been put away. The issue was resolved while we were out for the evening. We did request for all towels/wash clothes to be swapped out and for additional towels as there were only 3 for our 4 night stay and were advised there are ONLY 4 towels for the unit, but that they had been freshly laundered while we were out. We went to Walmart and bought our own. Bring extra toilet tissue so you don't run out at 11pm like we did, ;0) as there is only the 1 roll provided. The king bedroom has a door to the outside with built in blinds, no curtain, for those like myself who are light sensitive.
